intro: Sarcomphalus crenatus, commonly known as the serrated sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and small, clustered flowers. Native to arid and semi-arid regions, it thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. The plant typically blooms in spring or early summer, producing white or pale pink flowers. Its compact growth habit and ornamental foliage make it a suitable choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
